requirements.jd_requirement: 4+ years professional experience in building and deploying software or services as part of a corporate or enterprise security engineering team.
requirements.matched_skills: Secure implementation practices, Deployable security controls, Risk reduction engineering
requirements.evidence: Conner has built and operated production-grade security systems across endpoint, cloud, and identity domains—focusing on deployable controls with measurable risk reduction in real-world environments.

requirements.jd_requirement: Deep, hands-on understanding of the current landscape of cybersecurity tools (EDRs, device management, identity, SIEMs, SOARs, XDRs, etc) and experience configuring, tuning, or automating these systems via APIs.
requirements.matched_skills: API-driven security workflows, Remediation scripting, Administrative tooling
requirements.evidence: Conner has automated workflows across CrowdStrike Falcon, Defender XDR, and Rapid7 InsightVM via APIs; built runbook-driven remediation pipelines for endpoint patching and device management.

requirements.jd_requirement: Experience implementing or assisting with the implementation of enterprise / corporate security controls such as anti-malware policies, identity and access controls, detection engineering, device management, or similar.
requirements.matched_skills: Access control implementation, MFA integrations, Authentication provider integration
requirements.evidence: Conner has architected IAM integrations across identity portals and authentication providers, implemented cross-team access control policies, and built operational guardrails for IAM deployments.

requirements.jd_requirement: Development experience in any modern programming language, including but not limited to Python, Rust, or Go.
requirements.matched_skills: CI/CD pipelines, Automated build and deploy workflows
requirements.evidence: Conner builds production tooling in Python (Flask, FastAPI) and PowerShell; has shipped CI/CD pipelines via GitHub Actions/GitLab CI with infrastructure-as-code (Terraform, Ansible).

requirements.jd_requirement: Interest in modern machine learning or artificial intelligence capabilities, especially emerging subsets of Generative AI such as agentic behavior, tool calling, knowledge graph integration, retrieval augmented generation, etc.
requirements.matched_skills: RAG pipelines, LangChain, Embeddings-based retrieval, Retrieval tuning
requirements.evidence: Conner has built auditable RAG pipelines using LangChain and vector databases for security context retrieval, with emphasis on governance and operational safety.

requirements.jd_requirement: Ability to deal with ambiguity and learn new technologies quickly.
requirements.evidence: Conner consistently turns ambiguous operational problems into deployable controls—documenting runbooks and translating stakeholder needs into maintainable systems.

tone_notes: Match wraithwatch’s tone: mission-driven, security-first, pragmatic engineering. Emphasize ownership, reliability, and operational impact—not just technical capability. Avoid hype; focus on deployable systems, resilience, and measurable outcomes.
summary_angle: Position Conner as a security engineer who builds and operates production-grade systems where ambiguity meets real-world constraints—highlighting his work at the intersection of security automation, cloud-native delivery, and AI-augmented SecOps with a bias for operational reliability.
